alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 3:19PM CDT until April 05 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN AND PARTS OF THE CENTRAL TEXAS AND OKLAHOMA PANHANDLES... * Affected Area...In Texas...Oldham and Deaf Smith. * 20 Foot Winds...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. A cold front will move through the Oklahoma and most of the Texas Panhandles during the mid and late afternoon hours today through through this evening. The cold front will shift the 20 foot winds to the northwest and north 20 to 30 mph with gusts near 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 9 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...2 to 6. * Timing...Noon through 9 PM CDT Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
